answers.answer: Hi there. First of all consult an optometrist for an error of refraction testing which could cause blurring of vision and difficulty in focusing. If this is ruled out, consider migraines, hypertension, rule out diabetes, meneire’s disease. Rarely multiple sclerosis also presents first as blurred vision and color distortions. An MRI brain would be required once the systemic illnesses are checked for. Consult your neurologist for further clinical evaluation .Take care.

question: At times i cant focus my eyes on words or objects, blurred vision and sometimes dizziness. Sometimes a head ache and blotchy vision.
title: Blurred vision, cant focus and dizziness
